column4: I have a built-in speaker on a desktop computer that plays system bell sounds, and played the little background music of the Win XP Home OEM-supplied end-user config stuff (which I declined).  How can I make all sounds (music, etc.) play through this speaker, rather than only through the headphone jack?
or plug those speakers to the headphone jack
They're internal speakers.  that would involve soldering inside the machine.  There must be a better way than that.
ah, that speaker. that cant be done, to my knowledge :)
Well it must be possible to make it do something other than beep, b/c Windows can use it :S
that speaker is just connected to a tonegenerator on the motherboard, for system beeps. you mean windows plays music on that one?
Yes, or at least it played the background music for the OEM-to-end-user setup.  I declined the EULA, so I don't know any further than that.
yes, well, you cant play your mp3s through there, if thats what you mean :)
its not in any way connected to your soundcard; just a simple tone generator
Then how was it playing that stuff?
the software just tells it what tones to create, and it does. its like the ringtones of a cellular phone
Sounded more complex than that, but maybe not.
Is the text file with the package names one per line or all in a row?
all in one line, with just spaces between. i though that would simplify things :)
It does - you can leave out xargs from that line then.
